name: Grizzly Ultramarathon Wales

difficulty.label: Extreme
difficulty.technical: Technical mountain trails, navigation required, exposed ridgelines

description: A brutal early-season test through the wild heart of the Black Mountains. The Grizzly Ultramarathon delivers everything Wales does best: unforgiving ascents, technical descents, and vast empty landscapes that make you feel genuinely alone with the mountains. Starting from the picturesque town of Crickhowell, the route climbs into the Black Mountains, traversing exposed ridgelines, boggy moorland, and ancient drovers' paths. March conditions add an extra layer of challengeâ€”expect cold, wind, and potentially snow at altitude. This isn't a race for the faint-hearted, but for those who embrace the wild, it's an unforgettable journey through some of Wales' most spectacular and least-trodden terrain.
who_its_for: Experienced ultra runners with strong navigation skills and mountain running experience. Not recommended for beginners. Winter kit essential for March conditions.
